channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Hurry! Only 8 seats left at 75% off
item.description: GOOD MORNING! From February 16 ‚Äì April 4, 2024 I won 69 trades IN A ROW using the strategy I teach in the $2,000 Small Account Journey. That‚Äôs nearly 2-months without a loss in Journey. The tiny $2,000 balance, at its peak, hit $47,965 June 13 up 2,298%. Definitely not typical but pretty awesome, right?! [‚Ä¶]

item.title: Biden praises U.S. economy‚Äôs strength as he insists he‚Äôs staying in race. He also refers to Kamala Harris as ‚ÄòVice President Trump.‚Äô
item.description: President Joe Biden spoke Thursday at a much-anticipated press conference as he faces calls to end his re-election campaign following a poor debate performance.

item.title: Wells Fargo shares tumble after net interest income falls short of estimates
item.description: The San Francisco-based bank recorded $11.92 billion in net interest income, a key measure of what a bank makes on lending, marking a 9% year-over-year decline.

item.title: Apple expands Vision Pro to more countries outside the U.S.
item.description: The Vision Pro will hit stores in Australia, Canada, France, Germany and the U.K. on Friday, following the headset's debut in Asian markets.

item.title: 2 hot penny stocks under $2
item.description: Good morning, Firstly, there‚Äôs only 50 16 seats left in the $2,000 Small Account Journey sale. You‚Äôll save 75% when you apply coupon code: SAVE75 and then learn an excellent edge in the market. We just started a new $2,000 balance this week. Trade #1 on NVDA +52% overnight. Trade #2 on NFLX +40% overnight. [‚Ä¶]

item.title: Why your grocery bill could be getting lower
item.description: PepsiCo and Conagra are among the companies dropping prices in response to inflation-weary consumers

item.title: Consumers are getting 'really choosy' as cracks emerge. Here's what that means for investors
item.description: With savings dwindling and the labor market softening, more companies are reporting changes in spending habits.

item.title: Elon Musk's X deceives users and breaches online content rules, EU says
item.description: Elon Musk's X is in breach of EU online content rules as the social media platform uses "dark patterns" to deceive users, the European Commission said Friday.

item.title: Stock Set for a Big Day! üìä

item.title: OK, boomer: You‚Äôre hoarding your nest egg, but your kids need financial help now
item.description: A viral X post asking whether to give your beneficiaries the money today, or let them wait to inherit it, has drawn more than 10 million views

item.title: U.S., Germany foil alleged Russian plot to assassinate CEO of German arms firm sending weapons to Ukraine
item.description: The alleged plot targeted the CEO of Rheinmetall, which provides artillery rounds to Ukraine and plans to open plants in Ukraine to make armored vehicles.

item.title: Ericsson shares rise after sales fall less than expected, North America returns to growth
item.description: Ericsson reported a smaller-than-expected 7% drop in second-quarter sales as sluggish demand for 5G gear was slightly offset by growth in North America.

item.title: Gearing up for another big week!

item.title: SpaceX Starlink mission runs into problems, as satellites‚Äô orbit is too low
item.description: ‚ÄúUnlike a Star Trek episode, this will probably not work, but it‚Äôs worth a shot,‚Äù said SpaceX CEO Elon Musk.

item.title: Biden won't drop out of election against Trump unless polls say 'there's no way you can win'
item.description: President Joe Biden is still on track to face Donald Trump despite some Democrats wanting Vice President Kamala Harris to become their nominee.

item.title: 'Why would you tinker with it if it's not broken?': Economist on why the Fed may not cut rates in September
item.description: There are risks to easing monetary policy that cast a cloud over the rate cut outlook, High Frequency Economics' Carl Weinberg told CNBC.

item.title: $2k balance challenge starts Monday

I‚Äôve made plenty of mistakes on this journey and some balances went lower. I‚Äôve accomplished some amazing things too, like taking a $2,000 balance as high as $32,000 and another $2,000 balance to $48,000. What I [‚Ä¶]

item.title: Oil prices higher after cooler U.S. inflation data
item.description: Oil futures rose Friday morning, aiming for a third straight winning session, after finding modest support the previous day following a cooler-than-expected June consumer-price index reading that reinforced expectations for the Federal Reserve to begin cutting interest rates later this year.

item.title: Biden loses his train of thought, calls Harris 'Vice President Trump' in solo press conference
item.description: President Biden has faced growing drop-out pressure from Democratic lawmakers, donors and from some voter polling after his debate flop against Donald Trump.

item.title: The world's top 250 fintech companies: 2024
item.description: 2024 has proven a transformative one for financial technology, with the market entering a new normal. In this climate, CNBC, together with Statista, has named the top 250 fintech companies globally.
